Paper Title: Can a biologist fix a radio?—Or, what I learned while studying apoptosis
Blurb: This insightful paper by Yuri Lazebnik discusses some very interesting points related to engineering vs. biology, and underlines the challenges associated with studying biological complexity.

Paper Title: From molecular to modular cell biology
Blurb: A nice essay on modularity in biology, and a systems perspective, from Leland Hartwell, who went on to win the 2001 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

Paper Title: Modelling viral and immune system dynamics
Blurb: An authoritative review on modelling the dynamics of viral infections e.g. HIV/HCV.

Paper Title: Numb3rs 1x03 - Vector (TV episode)
Blurb: The protagonist in this show is a mathematician, who uses SIR modelling to help the FBI track down the spread of a virus in a city.

Paper Title: VAX: Gamifying Epidemic Prevention
Blurb: An engaging game, that uses network theory to model the spread of an epidemic. Players need to stop epidemic spread by vaccinating/quarantining the right 'nodes' (people) from the network.

Paper Title: Leonhard Euler and the Koenigsberg Bridges
Blurb: A nice article recapitulating the history of the Koenigsberg bridges.

Paper Title: The truth about Koenigsberg
Blurb: Another article on the history of the bridges.

Paper Title: The SuiteSparse Matrix Collection
Blurb: The SuiteSparse Matrix Collection (formerly the University of Florida Sparse Matrix Collection) is a widely used set of sparse matrix benchmarks collected from a wide range of applications.

Paper Title: MATLAB Graph Functions Reference
Blurb: MATLAB has a suite of functions for studying/analysing networks; these are described here.

Paper Title: Network Biology
Blurb: A classic review on network biology capturing a very good breadth of topics, ranging from network parameters all the way up to network perturbations.

Paper Title: How Ideas Spread?
Blurb: A very nice article by Duncan Watts, the proponent of the small-world network hypothesis.

Paper Title: Using graph theory to analyze biological networks
Blurb: A nice review on graph theory applications in network biology.

Paper Title: Star Wars Social Network! (by Evelina Gabasova)
Blurb: A fun exercise, studying the social networks in Star Wars movies!

Paper Title: Collective dynamics of ‘small-world’ networks
Blurb: The original paper on small world networks.

Paper Title: Complex networks: Structure and dynamics
Blurb: Extremely detailed paper on networks (a mini book/reference!)

Paper Title: Complex Networks: Small-World, Scale-Free and Beyond
Blurb: A lucid easy-to-read paper discussing network models.

Paper Title: How Network Theory Is Revealing Previously Unknown Patterns in Sports
Blurb: An interesting read on the use of network science in sports.

Paper Title: Emergence of Scaling in Random Networks
Blurb: The original paper on scale-free networks.

Paper Title: Structure and Function of Complex Networks
Blurb: Another excellent review/mini-book on networks, covering a wide gamut of topics.

Paper Title: Network motifs in the transcriptional regulation network of _Escherichia coli_
Blurb: The classic paper defining the concept of network motifs.

Paper Title: Network motifs: Simple building blocks of complex networks
Blurb: Another excellent paper building on the concept of network motifs.

Paper Title: FANMOD: a tool for fast network motif detection**
Blurb: An easy-to-use software tool for motif detection.

Paper Title: Aggregation of topological motifs in the _Escherichia coli_ transcriptional regulatory network
Blurb: An insightful analysis of the organisation of _E. coli_ transcriptional regulatory networks: motifs, clusters and superclusters.

Paper Title: Motifs, themes and thematic maps of an integrated _Saccharomyces cerevisiae_ interaction network
Blurb: Discusses the concept of ‘network themes’—classes of higher-order recurring interconnection patterns encompassing multiple occurrences of network motifs.

Paper Title: Error and attack tolerance of complex networks
Blurb: The classic paper illustrating the robustness of scale-free networks to random failures, and susceptibility to targeted attacks.

Paper Title: Attack vulnerability of complex networks
Blurb: An elaborate analysis of four different attack strategies on a variety of complex networks, based on degree/betweenness centrality.

Paper Title: Lethality and centrality in protein networks
Blurb: The classic paper (with the classic colourful protein interaction network image!) showing how highly connected proteins in a network are much more likely to be essential for (yeast) survival.

Paper Title: Nine quick tips for analyzing network data
Blurb: A good article emphasising important "good practices" for analysing network data.

Paper Title: The human disease network
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: An excellent paper detailing the construction and analysis of bi-partite graphs to study diseases, symptoms, and genes.

Paper Title: Edgetic perturbation models of human inherited disorders
Blurb: The classic paper on "edgetics".

Paper Title: Differential network biology
Blurb: The classic paper describing DiNA, and its application to study some example disease conditions.

Paper Title: Network-based features enable prediction of essential genes across diverse organisms
Blurb: Emphasises the remarkable utility of network-based features in predicting essential genes in interactomes.

Paper Title: The organisational structure of protein networks: revisiting the centrality—lethality hypothesis
Blurb: Re-examines the centrality—lethality hypothesis from the perspective of essentiality data from DEG, and interactomes from STRING.

Paper Title: Adapting Community Detection Algorithms for Disease Module Identification in Heterogeneous Biological Networks
Blurb: Discusses multiple strategies to identify disease-relevant modules from biological networks.

Paper Title: NetGenes Database
Blurb: Predicts essential genes across 2700+ organisms, capturing local, global and neighbourhood properties of STRING interactomes to extract features.

Paper Title: Assessment of network module identification across complex diseases
Blurb: A detailed assessment of numerous algorithms for community detection, as applied to identify disease modules in multiple types of networks.

Paper Title: Predicting novel metabolic pathways through subgraph mining
Blurb: A method for retrosynthesis that uses only structural information to predict and rank possible biotransformations.

Paper Title: Protein structure: insights from graph theory
Journal: Journal of Theoretical and Computational Chemistry
Blurb: One of the classic papers describing the application of graph theory to represent and understand protein structures.

Paper Title: The Protein Folding Network
Blurb: A detailed study of the network properties of protein folding pathways.

Paper Title: A General Mechanism for the Propagation of Mutational Effects in Proteins
Blurb: A study that integrates data from published NMR experiments, molecular dynamics simulations and network theory to model the allosteric effects of point mutations.

Paper Title: Toward a quantitative description of microscopic pathway heterogeneity in protein folding
Blurb: An extraordinary paper that applies numerous tools from network theory to shed light on possible microstates in protein folding pathways.

Paper Title: Missing and spurious interactions and the reconstruction of complex networks
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: A very interesting study on link prediction in networks.

Paper Title: Network representations and methods for the analysis of chemical and biochemical pathways
Blurb: A nice review on various biological networks and their analyses, including chemical and biochemical reaction networks.

Paper Title: An Introduction to Dynamical Systems
Blurb: A nice introduction to dynamical systems.

Paper Title: Quantitative Modeling in Cell Biology: What Is It Good for?
Blurb: A simple and easy-to-read review, with some lucid examples of dynamic modelling, applied to biology.

Paper Title: Biochemical Systems Theory: A Review
Blurb: A nice overview of BST (Biochemical Systems Theory).

Paper Title: Linking data to models: data regression
Blurb: An excellent reference on parameter estimation / regression that makes many critical points.

Paper Title: Good practices for building dynamical models in systems biology
Blurb: A critical analysis of possible pitfalls in dynamical modelling, with a detailed flowchart for rigorous model development.

Paper Title: Reverse engineering and identification in systems biology: strategies, perspectives and challenges
Journal: Journal of the Royal Society Interface
Blurb: A nice survey of some important topics related to reverse engineering and system identification in systems biology.

Paper Title: Recent developments in parameter estimation and structure identification of biochemical and genomic systems
Blurb: A useful overview of parameter estimation in biological systems.

Paper Title: Parameter Estimation in Biochemical Pathways: A Comparison of Global Optimization Methods
Blurb: A critical comparison of methods for parameter estimation.

Paper Title: Programming biological models in Python using PySB
Blurb: Describes PySB, a new approach to create models _as_ programs.

Paper Title: Dynamical modeling and multi-experiment fitting with PottersWheel
Blurb: PottersWheel is a MATLAB toolbox for numerically fast mechanistic mathematical modeling, and can be applied to any ODE system.

Paper Title: Evolutionary Computation
Blurb: An excellent overview of evolutionary computation.

Paper Title: Sensitivity analysis approaches applied to systems biology models
Blurb: A very nice overview of sensitivity analysis for systems biology.

Paper Title: An Introduction to Genetic Algorithms, by Melanie Mitchell
Blurb: A lucid introduction to genetic algorithms.

Paper Title: GAs for Travelling Salesperson Problem
Blurb: Discusses GAs to solve TSP, including a tutorial with interactive Java Applets.

Paper Title: Modelling and analysis of gene regulatory networks
Blurb: An excellent review detailing multiple methods for modelling gene regulatory networks.

Paper Title: Boolean network simulations for life scientists
Journal: Source Code for Biology and Medicine
Blurb: Describes the BooleanNet tool.

Paper Title: Boolean Modeling of Genetic Regulatory Networks
Blurb: A classic paper on modelling genetic regulatory networks, with application to _Drosophila melanogaster_ segment polarity genes.

Paper Title: Robustness and fragility of Boolean models for genetic regulatory networks
Blurb: Integrates stochasticity nicely, into Boolean modelling.

Paper Title: Algebraic Models of Biochemical Networks
Blurb: Discusses generalisations of Boolean networks (algebraic models).

Paper Title: Dynamical analysis of a generic Boolean model for the control of the mammalian cell cycle
Blurb: A lucid paper, explaining how the cell cycle can be well-modelled using Boolean networks.

Paper Title: BooleSim**
Blurb: BooleSim tool, which can be tinkered around with just a web browser.

Paper Title: BooleanNet**
Blurb: BooleanNet, a Python-based tool for Boolean Network analysis.

Paper Title: Predicting Essential Components of Signal Transduction Networks: A Dynamic Model of Guard Cell Abscisic Acid Signaling
Blurb: Another excellent illustration of using Boolean networks to model cellular signalling/regulation.

Paper Title: A protocol for generating a high-quality genome-scale metabolic reconstruction
Blurb: The classic paper discussing a detailed 96-step protocol for careful manual curation and reconstruction of a constraint-based model.

Paper Title: What is flux balance analysis?
Blurb: A classic pedagogical piece introducing flux balance analysis.

Paper Title: Advances in flux balance analysis
Blurb: The classic review on FBA.

Paper Title: Flux balance analysis of biological systems: applications and challenges
Blurb: A simple review on constraint-based modelling approaches, with an illustration of a simple FBA.

Paper Title: Analysis of optimality in natural and perturbed metabolic networks
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: The classic paper on quadratic programming applied to COBRA: Minimisation of Metabolic Adjustment (MoMA).

Paper Title: Using Genome-scale Models to Predict Biological Capabilities
Blurb: An excellent review covering various applications of metabolic modelling.

Paper Title: Regulatory on-off minimization of metabolic flux changes after genetic perturbations
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: This paper describes ROOM, an MILP-based method for constraint-based analysis of metabolic networks.

Paper Title: _In Silico_ Identification of Gene Amplification Targets for Improvement of Lycopene Production
Blurb: This paper describes FSEOF, for identifying over-expression targets in metabolic networks, for metabolic engineering.

Paper Title: Computational identification of gene over-expression targets for metabolic engineering of taxadiene production
Blurb: A nice illustration of computational approaches to identify over-expression targets for metabolic engineering.

Paper Title: Predicting Gene Essentiality Using Genome-Scale _in silico_ Models
Blurb: A nice review, detailing the strengths and limitations of constraint-based modelling, especially for predicting gene deletions/phenotypes.

Paper Title: Fast-SL: an efficient algorithm to identify synthetic lethal sets in metabolic networks
Blurb: Describes a novel and rapid method for identifying synthetic lethals in metabolic networks, by cutting through the search space.

Paper Title: Genome-scale gene/reaction essentiality and synthetic lethality analysis
Blurb: Describes SL-Finder, an MILP-based method to identify synthetic lethals.

Paper Title: Enumeration of Smallest Intervention Strategies in Genome-Scale Metabolic Networks
Blurb: Describes MCSEnumerator, an efficient MILP-based method to identify synthetic lethals.

Paper Title: Global reconstruction of the human metabolic network based on genomic and bibliomic data
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: The classic reconstruction of human metabolic network, "Recon 1"

Paper Title: A community-driven global reconstruction of human metabolism
Blurb: The Recon 2 human metabolic model.

Paper Title: Computational reconstruction of tissue-specific metabolic models: application to human liver metabolism
Blurb: Tissue-specific metabolic reconstruction.

Paper Title: Insight into human alveolar macrophage and _M. tuberculosis_ interactions via metabolic reconstructions
Blurb: Modelling host–pathogen interactions using metabolic modelling.

Paper Title: A multi-tissue type genome-scale metabolic network for analysis of whole-body systems physiology
Blurb: Tissue-specific metabolic reconstruction, for Recon 1, modelling adipocytes, hepatocytes, and myocytes.

Paper Title: Reconstruction of Genome-Scale Active Metabolic Networks for 69 Human Cell Types and 16 Cancer Types Using INIT
Blurb: Excellent example of context-specific metabolic reconstructions.

Paper Title: Predicting selective drug targets in cancer through metabolic networks
Blurb: The first genome-scale metabolic model of cancer metabolism.

Paper Title: Large-scale _in silico_ modeling of metabolic interactions between cell types in the human brain
Blurb: A workflow that integrates gene expression data, proteomics data and literature-based manual curation to model human metabolism within and between different types of cells.

Paper Title: A compendium of inborn errors of metabolism mapped onto the human metabolic network
Blurb: A comprehensive knowledgebase of inborn errors of metabolism.

Paper Title: Predicting the impact of diet and enzymopathies on human small intestinal epithelial cells
Blurb: This paper defined fifty metabolic tasks to evaluate model functionalities.

Paper Title: How Will Bioinformatics Influence Metabolic Engineering?
Blurb: A classic review, discussing computational approaches for metabolic engineering.

Paper Title: Basic concepts and principles of stoichiometric modeling of metabolic networks
Blurb: An excellent review covering the breadth of metabolic modelling.

Paper Title: The Convex Basis of the Left Null Space of the Stoichiometric Matrix Leads to the Definition of Metabolically Meaningful Pools
Blurb: A nice paper providing detailed insights into stoichiometric matrix and the convex basis of the metabolic solution spaces.

Paper Title: Systemic metabolic reactions are obtained by singular value decomposition of genome-scale stoichiometric matrices
Blurb: SVD analysis of the stoichiometric matrix.

Paper Title: Constraining the metabolic genotype–phenotype relationship using a phylogeny of _in silico_ methods
Blurb: A detailed review of the entire family of COBRA methods (with a beautiful method phylogeny picture).

Paper Title: Regulation of Gene Expression in Flux Balance Models of Metabolism
Blurb: The classic paper on rFBA.

Paper Title: Interpreting Expression Data with Metabolic Flux Models: Predicting _Mycobacterium tuberculosis_ Mycolic Acid Production
Blurb: Describes the E-Flux method for integration of regulatory information.

Paper Title: Probabilistic integrative modeling of genome-scale metabolic and regulatory networks in _Escherichia coli_ and _Mycobacterium tuberculosis_
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: Describes the PROM approach for integration of regulatory information from gene expression datasets.

Paper Title: Constraint-based models predict metabolic and associated cellular functions
Blurb: An excellent review on constraint-based models and their applications.

Paper Title: Identifying gene targets for the metabolic engineering of lycopene biosynthesis in _Escherichia coli_
Blurb: A classic application of FBA for metabolic engineering, including identification of a triple knock-out for improving lycopene production.

Paper Title: Flux Balance Analysis of Mycolic Acid Pathway: Targets for Anti-Tubercular Drugs
Blurb: A classic application of FBA for drug target identification by modelling the mycolic acid pathway in _Mycobacterium tuberculosis_.

Paper Title: targetTB: A target identification pipeline for _Mycobacterium tuberculosis_ through an interactome, reactome and genome-scale structural analysis
Blurb: A rigorous pipeline for drug target identification in _Mycobacterium tuberculosis_.

Paper Title: Applications of genome-scale metabolic reconstructions
Blurb: A detailed review, discussing various classes of applications of constraint-based modelling.

Paper Title: The application of flux balance analysis in systems biology
Journal: Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Systems Biology and Medicine
Blurb: A nice and simple overview of FBA and related methods, with applications.

Paper Title: Genome-scale metabolic networks
Journal: Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Systems Biology and Medicine
Blurb: A very nice review on various aspects of metabolic network reconstruction and simulation.

Paper Title: Elementary flux modes in a nutshell: Properties, calculation and applications
Blurb: A neat introduction to EFM analysis, using a "metro map" analogy.

Paper Title: Detection of elementary flux modes in biochemical networks: a promising tool for pathway analysis and metabolic engineering
Blurb: An excellent paper on EFMs.

Paper Title: Elementary mode analysis: a useful metabolic pathway analysis tool for characterizing cellular metabolism
Blurb: A nice review detailing EFMs, especially their applications for metabolic engineering.

Paper Title: Comparison of network-based pathway analysis methods
Blurb: A neat illustration of EFM vs. EPA analyses.

Paper Title: On Elementary Flux Modes in Biochemical Reaction Systems at Steady State
Blurb: The classic paper on EFMs.

Paper Title: Extreme Pathway Analysis of Human Red Blood Cell Metabolism
Blurb: Discusses EPA, for studying human RBC metabolism.

Paper Title: High-throughput metabolic flux analysis based on gas chromatography–mass spectrometry derived 13C constraints
Blurb: A classic paper giving a clear rundown of 13C-MFA.

Paper Title: 13C Metabolic Flux Analysis
Blurb: A classic review on 13C-MFA.

Paper Title: 13C-based metabolic flux analysis
Blurb: A detailed protocol paper elucidating the 13C-MFA approach.

Paper Title: How to measure metabolic fluxes: a taxonomic guide for 13C fluxomics
Blurb: Another excellent review on 13C-MFA.

Paper Title: 13C Metabolic Flux Analysis for Systematic Metabolic Engineering of _S. cerevisiae_ for Overproduction of Fatty Acids
Blurb: A nice illustration of flux analysis for improving production of fatty acids in yeast.

Paper Title: Host–pathogen systems biology
Blurb: A nice review on host–pathogen systems biology.

Paper Title: Modelling Viral and Immune System Dynamics
Blurb: An authoritative review on modelling the dynamics of viral infections e.g. HIV/HCV.

Paper Title: Immunology for physicists
Blurb: A detailed review of an extraordinary variety of models of the immune system, from a physicist's perspective.

Paper Title: Boolean models of within-host immune interactions
Blurb: An excellent application of Boolean network modelling to study host–pathogen interactions.

Paper Title: Constraint-based analysis of metabolic capacity of _Salmonella_ typhimurium during host-pathogen interaction
Blurb: A nice application of constraint-based modelling to study host–pathogen interactions.

Paper Title: A systems perspective of host–pathogen interactions: predicting disease outcome in tuberculosis
Blurb: A detailed systems-level model of TB infection, capturing a large number of interactions between the pathogen and the host immune system.

Paper Title: Current trends in modeling host–pathogen interactions
Journal: Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery
Blurb: Another nice review on host–pathogen systems biology.

Paper Title: Metabolic modeling of a mutualistic microbial community
Blurb: The classic paper on applying FBA to model microbial communities.

Paper Title: Enumerating all possible biosynthetic pathways in metabolic networks
Blurb: Details the MetQuest approach to enumerate biosynthetic pathways, which can span even across microbes.

Paper Title: SteadyCom: Predicting microbial abundances while ensuring community stability
Blurb: An excellent paper detailing the background of community modelling approaches, and focussing on the SteadyCom approach, one of the best approaches based on constraint-based modelling.

Paper Title: Investigating metabolic interactions in a microbial co-culture through integrated modelling and experiments
Blurb: An integrated experimental and computational approach, defining an index measuring the metabolic dependency between organisms.

Paper Title: Modelling approaches for studying the microbiome
Blurb: A detailed review on metabolic modelling of microbial communities.

Paper Title: Introduction to Synthetic Biology
Blurb: A fun over-simplified introduction to synthetic biology, paralleling it with computers.

Paper Title: Synthetic Biology, Inventing the Future by Andrew Hessel*
Blurb: A nice interview of Andrew Hessel, on synthetic biology.

Paper Title: Synthetic Biology: Honors Colloquium by JJ Collins*
Blurb: An excellent talk by JJ Collins, one of the most renowned scientists in synthetic biology.

Paper Title: Realizing the potential of synthetic biology
Blurb: A nice interview-type article on synthetic biology.

Paper Title: Foundations for engineering biology
Blurb: A nice engaging review of synthetic biology.

Paper Title: Genome-scale engineering for systems and synthetic biology
Blurb: An excellent review of technologies and methodologies for genome editing in synthetic biology.

Paper Title: The second wave of synthetic biology: from modules to systems
Blurb: A nice overview of multiple synthetic biology circuits.

Paper Title: The art of molecular compute: Whence and whither
Blurb: A detailed review of DNA computing,  highlighting key experiments across three different eras of molecular computation, beginning with molecular solutions, transitioning to logic circuits and ultimately, more complex molecular networks.

Paper Title: Biological Robustness
Blurb: A classic review of concepts of biological robustness.

Paper Title: Bow ties, metabolism and disease
Blurb: A nice discussion of bow ties in biological systems.

Paper Title: Complexity and Robustness
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: A detailed piece on highly optimised tolerance.

Paper Title: Evolution of Bow-Tie Architectures in Biology
Blurb: A very interesting paper, showing how bow-ties can evolve spontaneously under certain conditions/constraints.

Paper Title: Neutralism and selectionism: a network-based reconciliation
Blurb: A wonderful treatise on neutralism vs. selectionism, from a 'neutral' network perspective.

Paper Title: Innovation and robustness in complex regulatory gene networks
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA
Blurb: Robustness, evolvability and innovation, as studied in a gene regulatory network system.

Paper Title: Robustness and evolvability: a paradox resolved
Journal: Proceedings of the Royal Society B: Biological Sciences
Blurb: The classic paper, beautifully reconciling the seemingly paradoxical relationship between robustness and evolvability.

Paper Title: Andreas Wagner interview (Zürich Minds)**
Blurb: An interview of Andreas Wagner, discussing robustness, evolvability, and innovation.

Paper Title: The past 200 years in diabetes
Journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
Blurb: An interesting perspective on two centuries of diabetes.

Paper Title: Physiological regulation of the pancreatic β-cell: functional insights for understanding and therapy of diabetes
Blurb: A detailed overview of pancreatic β-cell regulation, with insights into drug targets and mechanisms.

Paper Title: Insulin: discovery and controversy
Blurb: An interesting read on insulin.

Paper Title: The impact of mathematical modeling on the understanding of diabetes and related complications
Blurb: A solid review on applications of QSP for diabetes modelling.

Paper Title: Simulating a Living Cell**
Blurb: An easy-to-read review on whole-cell modelling.

Paper Title: A Whole-Cell Computational Model Predicts Phenotype from Genotype
Blurb: The classic whole-cell model of _Mycoplasma genitalium_.

Paper Title: Bridging the gaps in systems biology
Blurb: A nice overview of the field of systems biology.

Paper Title: Reconstruction of biochemical networks in microorganisms
Blurb: A nice review on network reconstruction.

Paper Title: Deciphering Protein-Protein Interactions, Part I (Experimental Techniques)
Blurb: A detailed review on experimental approaches to study protein–protein interactions.

Paper Title: Deciphering Protein-Protein Interactions, Part II (Computational Techniques)
Blurb: A detailed review on computational approaches to study protein–protein interactions.

Paper Title: Reconstruction of cellular signalling networks and their properties
Blurb: A nice review on reconstruction of signalling networks.

Paper Title: A survey of metabolic databases emphasizing the MetaCyc family
Blurb: A detailed overview of MetaCyc family of metabolic network databases.

Paper Title: The Systems Biology Graphical Notation
Blurb: The classic paper detailing the SBGN framework.

Paper Title: Loren: Art of MATLAB**
Blurb: A very nice blog on the 'Art' of MATLAB, by MATLAB developer Loren Shure.

Paper Title: What Every Computer Scientist Should Know About Floating Point Arithmetic
Blurb: A highly cited classic on what every computer scientist, why everyone, must know about floating-point arithmetic!

Paper Title: Is Addition on a Computer Associative?**
Blurb: A nice blog article illustrating some classic pitfalls in floating-point arithmetic.

Paper Title: Wikipedia: Double-precision Floating-point Format**
Blurb: Wikipedia entry on the floating-point format.

Paper Title: Get Smart, Be Logical!
Blurb: A nice blog article emphasising the importance of logical indexing in MATLAB.

Paper Title: Ten simple rules for biologists learning to program
Blurb: A nice guide for folks trying to delve into the world of programming!
